Posts.Content: Post mastectomy syndrome is known to impose many psychosocial and physical influences on breast cancer patients. In 50% of patients, it negatively affects their daily activities, but they are still able to do most of it. On the other end, 25% of post mastectomy pain syndrome patients suffer from moderate to high negative impact on their daily activities. Such individuals may not be able to do any of their activities and might require 24 hour human support.
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy pain syndrome....disability???

Posts.Content: Hair almost always grows after chemotherapy; however, it may take a year or even more for hair to grow back. You can try taking vitamins that can support hair e.g. Vit A, E, C, Zinc. There are some pharmaceutical preparations that contain vitamins and minerals that can promote hair growth.
Posts.Title: My hair hasn't grown and it's been almost one year since I finished chemo???

Posts.Content: On Apr 07, 2012 12:19 PM rushna wrote: i m 21 yr old student. from past 5 years Â i suspected a small knot, shape of a pea (round) which was being treated by my uncle through homeopathic treatment. now its size has decreased , i mean i feel that it has reduced but now from past 1 month i feel itching near ma nipples. could it be because of sweat or skin allergy also i have pain in ma right breast(which has the knot) when i press it.( which i noticed today) could it be because of gym exercise which i started a week before could this knot be just a fibro? please guide me as sooon as possible i m realy tensed and scared waiting for a reply rushna s 21yrs INDIAN resident Hi Rushna, Of course, you have to see a surgeon, but I just want to assure you that small swelling like the one you described are mostly self limiting a fibroadenoma or a cyst blocked with secretions of breast glands or even a small abscess. In most cases, the surgeon will remove it and send it for tissue examination.
